item.description:
The calendar says September so Buffett and I are hoping for a break from summer heat for the First Sunday hike.  Just in case, however, we've planned to do a variation on one of our favorite hikes that passes several ponds so four-legged hikers (and possibly others) can get wet here and there.

We'll start out hiking along East Head Reservoir then cross over the Bentley Loop connector to head toward the old CCC camp.  Those wishing for a shorter hike can opt to continue around East Head.  The length of the rest of the hike will depend on the heat and the preference of the group but allow 2-3 hours.

Be sure to bring water for two- and four-legged hikers and maybe a snack to enjoy by a pond.  Dress for the weather, wear good hiking shoes, and bring bug spray or sunblock if you wish.

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: September First Sunday Hike
